title: Severe storm causes crane to partially collapse on the Gold Coast | ABC NEWS
description: Police have set up an exclusion zone on the Gold Coast after a severe storm caused a crane to partially collapse.  Emergency services were called to the Gold Coast Highway at Southport at 3:15pm on Thursday following reports of a crane and multiple powerlines being damaged in the area. title: How to spot dodgy deals and scams this Boxing Day | ABC NEWS
description: Australians have lost millions to shopping scams this year, prompting the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission and consumer advocates to urge shoppers to watch out for dodgy deals and online scams. Gary Mortimer, a retail marketing professor at Queensland University of Technology, warns about rogue retailers who inflate prices before Boxing Day sales and 'ghost stores' that appear online.  To stay safe, he suggests Googling the names of online retailers to verify their physical presence, checking customer testimonials and reviewing ratings on Trustpilot. title: Is Tim Wilson a future Liberal leader? | ABC NEWS
description: Liberal MP Tim Wilson has been openly ambitious about his future in the party.  On the Politics Now podcast, the Goldstein MP talks to Patricia Karvelas about his leadership aspirations, whether the Liberal party is capable of electing a gay leader, and the direction he wants the party to chart moving forward. title: Expats, backpackers swarm Coogee Beach for Christmas Day party | ABC NEWS
description: Cleaning crews have worked through the night at Coogee Beach after large crowds of expats and backpackers gathered for a Christmas party. While locals have expressed disappointment over the litter left behind, they are generally happy to see the young community enjoying themselves. title: King Charles pays homage to acts of 'spontaneous bravery' | ABC NEWS
description: King Charles III has paid tribute to community members who demonstrated "spontaneous bravery" in his annual Christmas message, recognising people who put "themselves in harm's way to defend others", like those who confronted terror at Bondi. The address was filmed at Westminster Abbey with a theme of 'pilgrims of hope' and watched by millions of people around the world. In his message, King Charles urged people of different faiths to find common ground and stressed the need for tolerance, saying the strength of modern societies lies in the diversity of their people. description: At the request of Nigeria's government, the US killed multiple Islamic State militants in north-west Nigeria, the US military said. title: US launches air strike on Islamic State militants in Nigeria | ABC NEWS
description: The United States carried out an air strike against Islamic State militants in north-west Nigeria at the request of Nigeria's government, US President Donald Trump and the US military said, claiming the group had been targeting Christians in the region. Nigeria's government has said armed groups target both Muslims and Christians and has agreed to work with the US to fight militant groups. title: Crane collapse exclusion zone displacing tourists on Gold Coast | ABC NEWS
description: An exclusion zone on the Gold Coast could remain in place for days as a crane damaged in a storm on Christmas Day teeters over residential streets. About 80 people have been evacuated from a neighbouring caravan park into temporary accommodation, many of them tourists now displaced while on holiday. Authorities said it may take days to safely dismantle the crane and allow the park guests back in to assess the damage. title: 'Huge amount of waste' left at Coogee following backpacker Christmas party | ABC NEWS
description: Thousands turned out to Coogee Beach after Bronte Beach was closed due to construction works. NSW Police said, despite 15,000 people turning up, everything ran smoothly with no arrests or fines. Randwick City Council said workers began a clean-up of the area about 7pm last night and by Friday morning had removed more than four truck loads of rubbish. description: A message of peace and unity rang out all across the globe as the faithful marked one of the most important days on the Christian calendar. description: Police in Melbourne have named a person of interest as they investigate an arson attack on a vehicle with a Hanukkah decoration in the early hours of Christmas morning. On Friday, detectives urged John Argento, a 47-year-old who lived a transient lifestyle in Melbourne, to contact police.
